channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large amount of rubbish left outside 42-44 De Beauvoir Crescent, 14th September
item.description:
Large bags with various waste were left outside our property in Sunday. This is a reoccurring issue.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Crescent, Hackney, London

item.title: Street lights not working, 14th September
item.description:
The street lights on Overbury Avenue are not working and it is pitch black.

item.title: The council garden space on the corner of dawlish Road and Dartmouth road, 14th September
item.description:
A large , long metal ladder has been abandoned on the side of the public garden . Not only is this unsightly , it is also dangerous as it could be used by any passing chancer to have a go at burglary of any of the homes in the area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dartmouth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: The traffic lights at the intersection of Mare Street and Graham road are stuck on read causing confusion for drivers and a lot of honking noise, 14th September
item.description:
Confusion and honking noise because of traffic lights stuck on red
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Graham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Dumped pool hazard, 14th September
item.description:
The occupants of 81A have put a pool out in a shared green space without consent from any other residents. It has gone from being used sparingly to left to rot. It is ridiculous that they have taken up so much space without consideration. As it remains abandoned to the elements, it is also starting to stink. It needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shrewsbury Lane, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clevedon Close, Hackney, London

item.description:

item.title: Streetlight is sparking, 14th September
item.description:
The streetlight outside the planet food shop by the bus stop looks like it is sparking, particularly when it rains. I have noticed this the last week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 298-300, Seven Sisters Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street Light - Equipment damaged, pole leaning

item.title: Cracked Manhole, 14th September
item.description:
Man hole cover down Perry Hall Road at the corner to Elmcroft is severely cracked. When cars or buses drive over it, you can see it crack and drop down, before moving back up once the vehicle has driven by. It has been getting steadily worse, but today was the first time I saw it physically drop when driven over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmcroft Road, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Impassable Walkway (ongoing), 14th September
item.description:
The walkway by this road junction has been dug up and left totally impassable for an unreasonable amount of time (since at least June 2025 based on other reports) with no remedial action. This is a danger to pedestrians who have to enter the roadway unnecessarily; the roadway is by a road junction and is a busy bus and general vehicle route. It is also unacceptable, through serious lack of action over many months, to endanger those with accessibility issues, pushchairs and other extenuating circumstances to be put at risk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Cameron Road, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip, 14th September
item.description:
Black bag and large garden umbrella dumped between containers this is a continually recurring situation so suspect someone local with easy access to the park in the evening ( There was also some rubbish left after an event which did not get picked up by the contractor and had been spread by animals- this was dealt with by the friends group this afternoon)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Japanese knotweed regrown, 14th September
item.description:
The previously reported Japanese knotweed in the planters next to pavement at 2 Cervantes Court, Inverness Terrace, have regrown, and should be destroyed before they grow into pavement and spread to Hallfield Estate and School

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cervantes Court, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet
